1519318727.given_title: The Fateful Vote That Made New York City Rents So High — ProPublica
1519318727.resolved_title: The Fateful Vote That Made New York City Rents So High
1519318727.excerpt: At the end of a pedestrian tunnel, down a flight of stairs from street level, a plush bar with a Prohibition motif caters to wealthy newcomers who have gentrified Manhattan's Lower East Side, displacing immigrants and blue-collar workers.

1669365267.excerpt: The frequency and scale of the spectacular fires that consumed much of the South Bronx and other areas of New York City throughout the 1970s can in large part be blamed on the recommendations for fire service reduction made by the New York City-RAND Institute and HUD between 1969 and 1976.

2569461617.excerpt: Tony’s Barber Shop, Cypress Park, Northeast Los Angeles. [Monica Nouwens for Places Journal] As the sun rises in Los Angeles, a handful of passengers wait for a downtown bus in front of Tony’s Barber Shop, on an exposed stretch of Figueroa Street near the Pasadena Freeway.

2635813493.resolved_title: 40 Years Ago: Neil Smith, Gentrification, and the Flow of Money
2635813493.excerpt: In 1979, Neil Smith — future professor of geography and anthropology, and a young PhD candidate studying under David Harvey — reconsidered the very foundations of gentrification, elucidating the cyclical flow of capital that continues to reshape city centers today.

3177929445.given_title: Pastors Launch Church-Planting Network for ‘Black and Brown Neighborhoods’
3177929445.resolved_title: Pastors Launch Church-Planting Network for ‘Black and Brown Neighborhoods’
3177929445.excerpt: The network represents a move to bring more people of color into leadership for church-planting initiatives and to focus more missional attention toward poor and underserved urban areas with high concentrations of ethnic minorities.

3178173976.given_title: Shifting the Church: Adapting to New Church Models
3178173976.resolved_title: Shifting the Church: Adapting to New Church Models
3178173976.excerpt: In the “Back to the Future: Changes and Shifts within the Church” series, Josh Laxton covers changes within the church that COVID has either exposed or expedited as well as shifts that churches need to make (in light of the changes) to engage in effective ministry and mission.

3181204064.given_title: Some Indigenous Women Theologians That You Should Know About
3181204064.resolved_title: Some Indigenous Women Theologians That You Should Know About
3181204064.excerpt: Indigenous women in Abya Yala and around the world live out their life path through the weaving of their wise ancestors who have left a legacy full of layers of wisdom as the Gunadule women say as they sew their molas.

3181575871.resolved_title: Befriending Books: On Reading and Thinking with Alan Jacobs and Zena Hitz
3181575871.excerpt: We like to think, of course, that we think; but what people allow to pass for thinking is usually about 90 percent reshuffling of images.

3181762051.excerpt: Editor’s Note: With America more polarized than ever, it is vital that Jesus’ followers take his teaching to love our enemies seriously.

3182209255.excerpt: LORD God of hosts, how long will you be angry with your people’s prayers? You have fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink in full measure. You make us the scorn of our neighbors; our enemies laugh among themselves.

3182367868.excerpt: Cathleen Falsani joins Uncommontary host Marty Duren to talk about the reality of ending world hunger in the next ten years. Hussein Ibish joins Uncommontary host Marty Duren for a conversation about today’s tumultuous Middle East.

3182512454.given_title: No, I am not looking forward to meeting physically as a church
3182512454.resolved_title: No, I am not looking forward to meeting physically as a church
3182512454.excerpt: Wherever I turn on social media, I see church leaders saying how all Christians are desperately longing for the day when we can leave Zoom behind us and get back to meeting physically in our church buildings, school halls or wherever. Sorry, count me out, I’m not looking forward to it at all.

3182766693.given_title: Squabbling over who is 'really' a Christian is hurting the Church's witness
3182766693.resolved_title: Squabbling over who is 'really' a Christian is hurting the Church's witness. We must do better
3182766693.excerpt: A woman driving on a bridge spots a man standing on the edge, preparing to jump. Pulling over, she jumps out of the car and shouts, “Stop!”  The man turns and says, “Why should I?”  The lady asks, “Are you religious?”  “Yes,” the man replies.  “Me too.

3183100373.given_title: Advent is a season of sighs, especially this year
3183100373.resolved_title: Advent is a season of sighs, especially this year
